article.class: post-49 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail

div.p: Good evening, all,

In our attempt to get ahead of the COVID-19 recent emergency declaration by our governor and formulate a school operations plan, I sent out an email explaining what we thought to be a responsible plan to keep our schools open until further notice.
At 5:00 pm MARCH 13th, Governor Dunleavy and Chief Medical Officer for the State of Alaska, Dr. Anne Zink, provided the following directives:
1) Effective March 16th thru Mar 30th, all public schools will be closed with the exception of residential boarding schools.

2) Employees, staff (classified and certified) will be expected to report to work and work with site administration to support contingency learning plans and nutrition service plans so that students have their basic needs met. Specific times for meal servings will be developed and shared by Monday morning.
3) Students will not be required to make up the lost contact days. Seniors need not worry about meeting graduation requirements because of the mandatory school closure.
4) All evening activities will halt. The schools will not be open for any weekend gatherings or open gym.
5) This is no longer a school board or administration decision. This is a decision coming from our commander-in-chief, Governor Dunleavy, who oversees all state public employees and state facilities.
6) We will continue to maintain updates as they become available. You can find them on the district website and we will utilize social media for announcements and updates.
Thank you, everyone, for your patience, understanding and commitment to keeping our villages safe.

Hannibal Anderson
Superintendent
Lower Yukon School District
907-591-2411 ext. 2003 (office)
907-591-6149 (cell)
aanderson@lysd.org

div.style: background-image: url(https://lysd.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/kid-pencil.png); background-repeat: no-repeat; background-position: center; background-size: 100%;

p.em: We are a people of the salmon, of the whitefish, and pike.

br.em: Of the moose, bear, fox, beaver, and lynx. Of the berries. Of family.

div.p:
We believe... All children can learn.
• Students should have skills to remain successful after high school
• All student deserve a quality education based on values, culture, and academics
• Students must know what is expected of them
• The family is the most important teacher in a child’s life
• The community educates the whole child
• All stakeholders must be held to high expectations
• Each of our communities is unique and has different needs
• Decision-making is a shared responsibility
• The people, groups, organizations, and agencies that comprise our community have a responsibility to the education of our children
• Communication should be useful and meaningful
• Students should learn to respect all cultures by having a firm understanding of their own

The ten villages that comprise the Lower Yukon School District are spread across 22,000 square miles. The Yukon River, one of the largest rivers in North America, winds through our yards on its way to the Bering Sea.
The purpose of our District's learning community is to ensure tradition, culture, and a quality education for all of our children.
